Trustworthy Online Course

As I researched the various Online TX Driving Safety Courses, I discovered that most of them will not allow you to see how much they charge for their available options as to how you can receive the certificate of completion. There are different fees for electronic certificates, standard mail, one-day & 2-day mail; you have to give your credit card number for the course before you can see how much more they are going to charge for how you receive the certificate of completion. I spent about 3 hours researching this and then I called Comedy Driving in Houston, TX directly at approximately 9pm to verify the prices on their website and my call was returned immediately. They only charge $2 for standard mail and $5 for the immediate electronic download. After I completed the course I received my certificate as a pdf to file and print within a few minutes. I did my research and I'm glad I found a trustworthy online course.

I enjoyed your class very much

I enjoyed your class very much. It kept me awake and laughing throughout the entire thing. I loved the animals in the videos. Funny.

What I didn't like was that you asked questions that I thought were irrelevant, such as the mile marker number on a sign in one segment and then asking how many police officers were directing traffic in another segment, or were on motorcycles.

Well, I was taking my own notes for testing purposes on the material itself. I didn't focus on a mile marker sign number or the number of officers in a video. I had to retake some sections due to those silly questions, which were irrelevlant to the material I was learning.

So, then I had to start focusing on things that had nothing to do with the learning material, which I thought was wasteful time for me. I get it, you need to make sure the person is actually paying attention, which I was, but I was only paying attention to the material, not other things in the video.

I loved the class otherwise. I would take it again if I had to take a defensive driving course again.

What is the point of that, other than to annoy the person taking the class (ie me)? There were also a handful of grammatical errors, but that's not part of the rating, I'm just pointing it out so someone can go through and fix them because that's not a great look. Other than that it was fine.

Better than a straight-up "sit…

Better than a straight-up "sit down/live" course, but not as funny as the title may lead people to believe. Only part I found really sort of funny was where the guy ran over the animals (although the points about NOT swerving were ones I never considered). Reginald was just plain obnoxious--I'd drop him or redo him. Jimmy Bobby was also a bit overdone, even for the typical East-Texas Redneck he largely portrays. I'd say Carl was the one that seemed most comical with how he got mad over such silly things.

My in-app review already stated this, but it would be best to put questions closer to the end or following up right after the vids end, and not putting up 2-3 new information segments, then asking the questions, which may not be answered correctly because now we're 5-6 minutes past the original content; I would frankly use an app like Edpuzzle or edit the vids so the questions pop up during the vid and the vid pauses: I would do this at 3-5 minute intervals max; don't have a vid lasting 15 minutes and then wait to spring questions on users right after--that's way too long.

The course was good and I passed but…

The course was good and I passed but the questions should be based around what's important in the video, not every little detail you show in a video. For example I got a question wrong because I didn't know what type of vehicle a police officer was seen driving in the beginning of the video for less than 5 seconds. Become A Better Driver - Save money on your car Insurance

This Driving Defensive course was a totally eye opening experience. You learn more about being a better driver on the road. They use actual driving in Houston videos to show how accidents happen, the proper procedures of turning right on red, how to drive during an outage of the traffic light. Watching out for drivers not paying attention. A moving and emotional tribute to people who lost their lives from texting and driving. Actual people who now have to live with the death of someone they love killed by their text messaging them. Learn so much information you may have not remembered from when you took drivers education when you were learning to drive. Also save money on your car insurance by taking the course. Its a great refresher on how to be a better driver on the road. Also if you have a moving violation on your driving record, taking the course can get it removed. It is a excellent program. Take the course and see if you don't become a better driver on Houston Roads.

Quirkiest but most effective technique…

Quirkiest but most effective technique I have ever seen. As an educator with much experience with curriculum, I was impressed with how the course is structured and monitored. There is potential for cheating but I don't know who would want to go through this pain for someone else. And besides, the person cheating would literally have to be seated right next to his/her proxy. Not even worth it.
I would add one major item missing- any changes in Texas law, to include year. There were a few times through the course when I though, when did that happen, and I've been driving over 40 years! Example, school bus stopping by certain medians, driving on the right shoulder to pass, etc. It would also lend more legitimacy to the course knowing that the most recent motor vehicle laws have been implemented.
All in all, great course.

Comedy Defensive Driving is the Best Option.

This program, although not comedy club caliber, does exactly what is claims to do: it fulfills the necessary state requirements of defensive driving, while at the same time keeping you entertained to a point where you remained focused on the presented material while time passes faster than you realize.

The animated characters that narrate the class are memorable, and some of the celebrity sound-alikes are fairly decent (Office Bakon (not Bacon) with a Patrick Warburton demeanor, Judge Dredd that sounds a lot like Christopher Walken, etc.)

To sum it up, this presentation is a complete thumbs up! If you choose Comedy Defensive Driving®, you wont be disappointed and you might learn a few things that will save time, aggravation, and lives on the highway.

Comedy Driving is the Best.

Of the two online DDC courses I have taken,one in 2018, Comedy Driving is the most informative and engaging course, I have ADHD. The engagement is probably why I was able to participate longer than two hours at a time. I went from Chapter 1 to Chapter 8 on Saturday May 28 @ 7:00pm and signed off around 12:45 May 29, 2021. What was even nicer about it is that the majority of the videos contained images of my Hometown of Houston, TX that included two of my neighborhoods, one in downtown Houston. I could identify with what they were talking about much better. It is no holds barred but funny and silly at the same time.

Humor over Boredom! You chose!

It was unfortunate that I needed to complete this driver's safety training, that was my choice. The Comedy Driving online setup was easy, the cost was acceptable, the course was effective, humorous and easy to complete in a half day sitting out by the pool! If you have the option of a boring agenda or adding a little humor into your life, you tell me which you would select! I highly recommend this online course. I am a repeat customer, unfortunately due to my life choice to put myself in a position to get speeding tickets, but if I can't change this requirement to take a driver safety training course, I feel the next choice I made was a wise one! Thanks Comedy Driving, Inc.

Easiest and best Defensive Driving course available

This course was very professionally put together. The information was presented in a clear and concise manner and the comic relief during the presentation kept it from being boring as most similar courses are. I benefitted from the reviewing of proper driving techniques and practices and the segment regarding impaired driving is very sobering and has a lasting, positive affect on the student based on the outcome potential of drinking/using while driving. I found it very convenient to be able to take the course in time intervals that met my work schedule and the details taken by the producers of the program made life easy, no digital snafus or problems whatsoever. I highly recommend this course for anyone who needs it or simply wants to improve their driving practices. At the end, retrieving and printing out the certificate required by the courts was so simple and I was in possession of a hardcopy within a few minutes of completing the course.

Due to insurance purposes regarding a…

Due to insurance purposes regarding a discount, I decided to come back to Comedy Driving, Inc. This course opened my eyes to the rules of the road in Texas as well as making me aware of not only looking out for other vehicles, but for pedestrians and bicyclists, as well. I applied the knowledge I gained from this class to my daily driving and elated to say that I avoided hitting a bicyclist riding against traffic, on the sidewalk, as I was exiting my work parking lot. Like the class stresses, look left, look right and then left again Good thing I looked right, otherwise, the consequences would've been devastating. Great class! I would recommend this class to anyone wishing to excel in their driving habits.

Enjoyable But Sometimes Glitchy

I enjoyed the class. Sometimes the jokes came off as a little too corny/cheesy, other times I did not see what was coming and got a genuine laugh.

In some cases the videos had trouble loading or they would glitch out, which worried me as I knew I couldn't hit the back button or I would lose my progress.

It's not all comedy. Some very important and informative topics are shown, such as the loss of life due to drinking and driving or texting and driving. I really do believe people need to see the impact that such issues can cause.

The best part, sometimes the voiceovers are impersonations of characters from animated comedies such as Family Guy and South Park (ex: Joe Swanson and Mr. Mackey).

Overall, an enjoyable experience for a defensive driving course.

FOUR STAR

FOUR STAR: Although I am confident that Comedy Driving (CD) improved my driving skills and I drive safer now by far—both worth FIVE STARS. My only qualms with CD is with the stereotypical depiction of 'hillbillies' with derogatory settings. Really, at every turn (pun intended) CD has a 'country boy' making dumb moves and saying stupid things. I am sure there was no insult intended and it does support the comedy theme, but the problem being: IT'S NOT FUNNY !

I would use the term "comedy" loosely

I would use the term "comedy" loosely. If by comedy you mean awfully acted cartoon characters that were more annoying than anything, then ok. I expected more of a stand-up style course. The questions were also frustrating. You watch a video on say, traffic signals and you are paying attention to many numbers and figures they are spamming you with - trying to focus on key words for the questions they may ask, yet when you get to the question is it irrelevant like what color shirt was the guy on the bike wearing that you saw for maybe 3 seconds of a 90 second video and he just breezed past. Or "what mile marker did the accident occur on" when it was barely shown and not pointed out to begin with. I would not take this course again.

New Technologies Make Driving Safer

Took the six hour Online Defensive Driving Course that is offered at a reasonable $25 price. Especially liked the sessions that covered some of the latest technologies that have been or will soon be introduced in automobiles and pickup trucks. Also liked the emphasis that was placed on the dangers of texting while driving. Completed the course on a Sunday and the certificate arrived via regular mail delivery on Tuesday!

Comedy Driving, Inc. - Excellent Tutorial

I had several choices of which Defensive Driving Course to take. I am very happy that I chose Comedy Driving, Inc. I was allowed to take the 6-hour course at my own pace, which allowed me to reflect on each chapter before moving on. I thoroughly enjoyed the comedic banter of the so-called students online and quickly discovered that their answers were always incorrect. I learned more than I thought I would, as I have been driving in Texas for over 50 years! I would recommend this course to all drivers as an excellent review of the rules of the road.

Different mindset.

I can honestly say that the accounts given in the program were honest, relatable, and very awe-inducing. The way I'll be driving in the future will absolutely be different because of the guidance this program provided for me in regards to reflecting on a very big part of my life. I didn't feel belittled or awful. I just felt like there were individuals out there who were taking the time to send me a very real message because they care about my life and others. I don't know that many people take a defensive driving course as seriously as I did but I think they should. I refuse to text anymore. I am reaffirmed in my decisions to simply not drink. And, I will be diligent about my focus and and my driving. The course not only changed a very big chunk of my life but it honestly may have provided me with the necessary reflections that could save my life. I'm glad I took this course. I need to slow down.

I feel like I learned or re-learned a lot for that matter and got clarity on some changes that have happened since I was taught to drive. There's no way to cheat, not pay attention, or have someone else do it for you since it has test questions that require a response within 90 seconds along with random verification questions so you don't really know when it will ask.

Comedy Driving Review

Comedy Driving Review

Thanks for the opportunity to send more feedback for the course taken. There are a few items that I would like to relay to you.

1. Having a son who's just recently gone through the driving education for Texas as provided by a private entity, there were several items that both he and I noted as contrary to what is being taught in the driving schools. One item was the hand position on the steering wheel. Not what is being taught. There were several other items. It would be beneficial for you to have a private entity who is approved by the TxDoT to review your content.
2. Also noted and vocalized by my son the following observation was made. With the recent racial (over)sensitivities in our contemporary culture today, it seems that there is quite a bit of 'fun' made of stereotypical elements of "some" parts of the "white" culture. The best way to ask yourselves if something seems racist is to replace different or other races in your scenario and see if it still seems appropriate. Your choices of whom to ridicule, though acceptable in current pop culture, comes off as inappropriate, offensive and racist.
3. The trick questions involved in the "Intersections" section were unnecessary. I understand that you are wanting to be sure that the attendee is being attentive to the videos. However, with my first missed test question - and I don't have the question in front of me to validate - was what vehicle the "cop" (police officer) was using when going 'through' the intersection. In the video, the officer on motorcycle didn't completely go "through" the intersection. Trick question. The second missed test question had to do with what what was the first video in the session. I believe that I answered "people stopping at the intersection" which was in the introduction and it was counted wrong. I'm guessing in retrospect that the 'correct' answer was the crashes. Perhaps I'm not remembering correctly, but this is what I recall. Again, these types of questions seemed "trick" and had no relation to the aspect of "safe driving". Unfortunate.

This is the first time I've used Comedy …

This is the first time I've used Comedy Driving. It's so much better than other courses I've used in the past, that I wish I could give Comedy 6 stars. It was easy to sign up... The course picked up exactly where I left off every time I logged in... It worked great on my iPhone, so I was able to do the course whenever I had a few minutes. I had ZERO problems!!! I divided the course over 3 days, and it felt like much shorter than 6 hours of course time--it went by fast. The test questions were fair and not difficult to answer if you paid attention. Each topic of the course was divided into short videos (a minute or two long) which made it easy to pay attention. Some of the characters were really cute... Listen carefully for some clever double entendres and word play. I have only one issue with the course: all the instructor characters were MALE. I would have liked to see female instructors, too!! Please add females! Nevertheless, I HIGHLY recommend Comedy Driving!!!

Comedy Driving was my online defensive driving course of choice, after researching all available options. Comedy Driving defensive driving course takes 6 hours to complete, plus a mandatory one hour break. The format used and the information provided is easy to follow and test and verification questions are easy to answer, if you pay attention, to pass the course. I found that as a result of taking this online defensive driving course, I'm more aware, careful, and safer driver. Comedy Driving provides a certificate of completion to be used to dismiss a traffic ticket and or receive a discount on your auto insurance!

I have done both comedy and non-comedy …

I have done both comedy and non-comedy online defensive driving. I find the non-comedy preferable....I do NOT find the comedy that funny. It felt very childish, and not because of the cartoons. I teach theatre, so I am used to different accents and voices of characters. Yet, I found some of the character's accents/character voices here made them very hard to understand (and there was no pause or back button on some of the videos to go back and listen again).
Another thing that I did NOT like....I felt that the test questions weren't always about the knowledge portion of the laws and safety rules. Some questions seemed to just be checking to see if you really watched the movies (Ie: what was the cop driving in the movie).
There was also a section of test questions that didn't count against us. I know that for some, I definitely entered the correct response (I also teach Health, which includes a chapter on alcohol that i do in depth with students). Some, I didn't even click on anything, and they buzzed as incorrect.
Finally, I did not find the alcohol game to be funny at all. If it isn't timed, why include it?!?!?!

Why I Liked the Comedy Driving Course

I thought this was one of the best ways to take Defensive Driving. With my busy life and work schedule it made it possible for me to take it in small sessions over a period of days. Drive with Comedy

I have taken an online driving class 2 other times in the last 12 years. This one seemed to go by much faster and not so much info trying to be said in a short amount of time. It seems some driving classes want to show off how much info they are teaching, I would say not say " teaching" is the right word, just blasting off as much info as fast as possible your mind can't take it all in, and you end up not retaining any of it. This one has reasonable amounts of info and some you just read, that helps to with not getting bored. I found the texting stories mini documentaries, obviously sad, however informative and alarming! I hope that part sticks! I plan to be far more aware of how often I am guilty of any cell activity while driving and STOP . The humor is silly, but that's the point. For what ever reason I did not find it as mind numbing as I thought it would be. The questions come right after the topic, so no way to forget or fail and if you miss a question for what ever reason, it allows you to go back and watch section again not entire hour, just that section. Then will ask you a different question, like what color was a drivers shirt. I found that a bit annoying and irrelevant. All in all I would say go with this one. Easy to access on any device. I took it on my phone and iPad. Stop start as much as you want, picks up where you left off. Could not be easier!

I would recommend it

I don't think there is a defensive driving course in existence that is super fun to attend. However, this one was relatively easy to sit through and actually provided me with some information I didn't already know. There are a couple of chapters that include real life stories of people (in texting and drunk driving accidents) which helped me to connect.

There is a timer on each screen that lets you know how long you must remain on that page (so people can't rush through the course without actually listening to the information). Sometimes the content of the page would finish 10-15 seconds before you were allowed to click to the next page. That was annoying but ultimately did not make a big difference. I could log in and out as I pleased, so I could complete the course in my own time. Four or five questions appear at the end of each chapter, so there is not one large exam at the end. I didn't think the course was super funny, but I think it was better than the one my husband took (which he said was extremely dry). I would choose this course again.

Level-headed humor drives the point that "driving is serious business".

Driving is serious business and with more and more vehicles on the road, one must stay alert, vigilant, and ever mindful of Texas law and rules of the road. Through statistical information, videos and humor, this course discusses these aspects and provides tips and recommendations to be used on the road as we, as defensive drivers, watch out for "the other guy" who may be impaired, emotional or otherwise not a smart driver with whom we share the road, but from whom we shield ourselves through defensive driving. Cartoon characters are exaggerated, but the "drive the point", (pun intended).

Comedy Driving, Inc. Is the best agency!!!

I sat down to takec the defensive driving course on a national holiday and had trouble with the site accepting my information to begin the course. I called the agency, did not receive an answer, of course being a holiday. I thought now I will have to go to another agency online, pay more money (the money already deducted from my bank account) to take the course. I was pretty frustrated when my phone rang. Lacy called from Comedy Driving, Inc. On a national holiday! I was SHOCKED!!!
She was extremely helpful, finished the sign in validation, got my computer compatible and I was soon moving through the course. A lot of good information and explanations for traffic laws, plus really eye opening of errors in my driving style that I need to change to be safer for me and everyone else on the road. I loved taking the quizzes at each chapter rather than one large quiz at the end. The agency has a great course and very helpful employees that want you to succeed.

Then there's validation questions about your drivers license and the vehicle. Those are easy. It's all multiple choice and some of the answers you can cancel out by looking at it. I'd recommend this to my friends if they got a ticket. Some of my friends did this same exact course and liked it.

Totally awesome

I cannot say enough good about this course. There is no final which takes a lot of pressure off. You only have 3 questions to answer after each section which also takes the pressure off and let's face it, taking these courses can be very frustrating. They give you a lot of good information, yet you don't have to try to remember every little detail because the questions are presented in a way that you just have to use common sense after having been presented with the information. They don't try to give you too much information at a time and then expect you to remember every little detail. I tried two other online courses before I found this one, and they had me sweating bullets. Logging in and out at your own leisure was good. Although the other courses had this feature as well, being under the pressure of having to take a final made you feel as if you had to finish the course as soon as possible as to not forget any of the information. This course, once you were finished with a section, you were done with it. You could go on to the next section not all tensed up. Thank you, thank you, thank you for the course. I learned so much.

If I'd taken the course before...

So I got into an accident- my fault. My first accident in 30 some years and what you go through afterwards is even more frustrating than the accident itself. I'd contracted with another company and completed about a quarter of the course. I ran into problems trying to log in where I'd stopped, trying to go back to recap and review, and finally, trying to communicate with the technicians for help. And the content? Please, I was bored and felt the presentation of content was more for elementary kids. I was willing to take a loss and quit that company. That experience sent me searching for another company when I found Comedy Driving, inc. I had one issue which was immediately address. I spoke to two technicians and my issue was handled without further ado.
The content was excellent. I was never bored, nor did I feel "talked down to". The content was easy to follow and it gave me a greater sense of security while driving. Just reviewing things I took for granted made me a better driver. I am more relaxed and not in a hurry. I'm more aware of my surroundings as I drive and certainly more polite. Thank you Comedy Driving for providing something positive out of this otherwise ugly situation.

Great Course - Speeds along
